concept.title: Summary of the nodes and resource control verbs

titlealts.navtitle: nodes and resource control verbs summary
titlealts.searchtitle: (): Summary of the nodes and resource control verbs

concept.shortdesc: A table of the nodes and resource control verbs, including references to the verb descriptions.

keywords.indexterm: CCA nodes and resource control verbs

table.title: Summary of nodes and resource control verbs

desc.p: Summary of nodes and resource control verbs

row.entry: Tracks the usage of ACPs for a defined span of time, and also queries that tracking information.
Retrieves information about the coprocessor and the application program in that coprocessor.
Retrieve the Security Application Program Interface (SAPI) version and build date.
Allocates specific coprocessor for use by the thread or process, depending on the scope of the verb.
De-allocates a specific coprocessor that is allocated by the thread or process, depending on the scope of the verb.

This verb initializes a key-storage file using the current symmetric or asymmetric master-key. The initialized key storage does not contain any preexisting key records. The name and path of the key storage data and index file are established differently in each operating environment. Note that HMAC keys are not supported for key storage.

This verb retrieves system log (SYSLOG) message data and log message data from the coprocessor. SYSLOG data is available for one of the five latest boot cycles (current boot cycle and up to four previous boot cycles). log message data is optionally available during the current boot cycle. The verb supports service personnel and developers in testing and debugging issues.

Operates on the three master-key registers: new, current, and old.
This verb is used to clear the new and the old master-key registers, generate a random master-key value in the new master-key register, XOR a clear value as a key part into the new master-key register, and set the master key, which transfers the current master-key to the old master-key register and the new master-key to the current master-key register.

Invokes the USA NIST FIPS PUB 140-1 specified cryptographic operational tests. These tests, selected by a rule_array keyword, consist of known-answer tests of DES, RSA, and SHA-1 processes and, for random numbers, monobit test, poker test, runs test, and log-run test.
